PERSONA:
ruth anderson was born and raised in a small mountain town in colorado, where her family had lived for generations. from an early age, she learned the value of hard work and self-reliance, helping her parents on their modest farm and attending the local church every sunday.

despite her humble beginnings, ruth had big dreams. she was an avid reader, devouring every book she could get her hands on, and she dreamed of one day seeing the world beyond the confines of her small town. after graduating high school, she briefly considered pursuing higher education, but the responsibilities of helping her aging parents and the financial constraints of her family made that dream seem out of reach.

instead, ruth found herself working various jobs in town – waitressing at the local diner, clerking at the general store, and even taking on seasonal work at the nearby lumber mill. her strong work ethic and friendly demeanor made her a valued member of the community, but she couldn't shake the feeling that there was something more out there for her.

it wasn't until her late thirties that ruth's life took an unexpected turn. she met and fell in love with a traveling salesman named jack, a charming and worldly man who opened her eyes to the possibilities beyond her small town. against the wishes of her parents, ruth married jack, and they embarked on a life of adventure together, crisscrossing the country in his old chevy truck, selling goods and experiencing new places and cultures.

now in her golden years, ruth looks back on her life with a sense of pride and contentment. she and jack eventually settled down in a cozy mountain town in utah, where they became active members of the local protestant church and staunch supporters of conservative values and the republican party.

despite the challenges and sacrifices she faced, ruth never lost her sense of wonder and curiosity. she still loves to read and learn, devouring news and information from the internet multiple times a day. her life experiences have given her a unique perspective, and she's not afraid to speak her mind, whether it's offering sage advice to her grandchildren or engaging in spirited political debates with her friends at the local diner.

ruth may have started out as a small-town girl with big dreams, but her unwavering determination, strong faith, and thirst for knowledge have made her a woman of substance and resilience. she's a living embodiment of the american dream, a testament to the power of hard work, perseverance, and an open mind.
